item.title: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud
item.description:
Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 have detailed two distinct and significant cybercrime operations. The first, a massive smishing campaign dubbed 'The Smishing Deluge,' is attributed to a China-based threat actor and is flooding mobile users globally with malicious SMS messages. The second ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

item.title: Pwn2Own Day 1: Hackers Net $522K for 34 Zero-Days in SOHO Devices
item.description:
The first day of Trend Micro's Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 competition was a resounding success for security researchers, who earned a total of $522,500 for demonstrating 34 unique zero-day vulnerabilities. In a stunning display, every single one of the 17 scheduled attempts against popular SOHO devices—in...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Threat Intelligence

item.title: 'GlassWorm' Worm Uses Unicode Obfuscation and Solana C2 in VS Code Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
A highly sophisticated, self-propagating worm named 'GlassWorm' is targeting Visual Studio developers through malicious extensions on the OpenVSX marketplace. The malware employs advanced evasion techniques, including using invisible Unicode characters to obfuscate its code and leveraging the Solana...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Ransomware Attacks on Critical Industries Skyrocket by 34%, KELA Reports
item.description:
A new report from cyber intelligence firm KELA reveals a staggering 34% year-over-year increase in ransomware attacks targeting critical industries between January and September 2025. These vital sectors, including manufacturing, healthcare, and energy, accounted for half of all 4,701 recorded globa...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

item.title: EU and Ukraine Deepen Cyber Defense Alliance in Face of Russian Aggression
item.description:
The European Union and Ukraine have reaffirmed their strategic partnership on cybersecurity during their 4th Cyber Dialogue held in Kyiv. Against the backdrop of Russia's ongoing war, both parties committed to deepening cooperation on cyber defense, policy alignment with EU standards like the NIS2 D...

item.title: Microsoft Report: AI-Generated Phishing Now 4.5x More Effective, Bypassing Traditional Defenses
item.description:
According to the Microsoft 2025 Digital Defense Report, the effectiveness of phishing attacks has surged with the adoption of artificial intelligence. AI-generated emails now achieve a 54% click-through rate, 4.5 times higher than traditional methods. The report, covering July 2024 to June 2025, als...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Malware

item.title: 'Mysterious Elephant' APT Evolves, Deploys Custom Tools in Espionage Campaign
item.description:
The cyber-espionage group known as 'Mysterious Elephant' has demonstrated a significant evolution in its capabilities, moving away from recycled malware to deploying its own custom-developed tools. Since early 2025, the APT group has been targeting government and diplomatic entities in South Asia. T...

Categories: Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

item.title: UK's NCSC Warns of 'Alarming' Rise in Cyberattacks, Doubling in Past Year
item.description:
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) revealed in its 2025 annual review that it managed 204 "nationally significant" cyberattacks over the past year, more than double the 89 incidents from the previous year. The agency attributed the alarming surge to increasing threats from state-sponsore...

item.title: Ransomware Attacks Surge by 46% as Threat Actors Target Construction and Manufacturing
item.description:
Despite a slight decrease in overall weekly cyber attacks, ransomware activity has surged by 46%, according to a new report from Check Point Research. This indicates a strategic shift by threat actors towards more focused and impactful ransomware campaigns. The construction, business services, and i...

item.title: Massive Botnet of 100k+ IPs Targets U.S. RDP Services
item.description:
Security researchers at GreyNoise have identified a massive, coordinated botnet campaign targeting Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) services across the United States. The operation, which began on October 8, 2025, involves over 100,000 unique IP addresses from more than 100 countries. The botnet is usi...

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence
